text:
Hi,
I have updated Apache to version 2.0.43, compiled it with all shred modules, --
with-ssl and --with-mpm=perchild (but the last doesn't matter 'cause error 
happens successfully with preform mpm) and now getting the following in my 
error.log:
[emerg] (28)No space left on device: Couldn't create cross-process lock
I have performed df -h and df -i, checked permissions - all should go ok, but 
something is still wrong.
creator: newton@aggressive.com
trawick@apache.org
text:
perchild MPM doesn't work with SysV semaphores.  Add "AcceptMutex fcntl"
to httpd.conf to fix it.

Later versions of perchild automatically switch to something else to
avoid the error.

MORE IMPORTANTLY: Please don't use 2.0.43 perchild.  You can use the rest
of 2.0.43, but pick up the latest perchild.c from CVS.  You can download that
file from this link.  Make sure you get the latest version.

http://cvs.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi/httpd-2.0/server/mpm/experimental/perchild/perchild.c

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 13311 ***
